items.title: Vigilante Batman
items.description: The Dark Knight watches over Gotham City from the heights. Digital art made with CS Paint.

items.title: Black Adam
items.description: Teth Adam: the champion of Kahndaq, wields the magical power granted by ancient wizards in order to protect his people. However, he chose his own path, a darker one than the wizards believed.

items.title: Batman (Comic panels)
items.description: Batman patrolling the streets of Gotham City. Storytelling and landscape practice.

items.title: Shazam
items.description: Billy Batson transforms into Shazam, the magical hero and defender of the Rock of Eternity. When he says the word "Shazam!" he gains the abilities and powers of ancient deities.

items.title: Darkseid (lineart)
items.description: Darkseid, the tyrannical ruler of Apokolips. An intergalactic conqueror who seeks the Anti-Life Equation to rule the universe.

items.title: Knights of Gotham
items.description: A battle of ideals represented by the Dark Knight and the Clown Prince of Crime.

items.title: Doctor Octopus
items.description: Otto Octavius (Doctor Octopus, Doc Ock), after an accident, a mechanical harness becomes permanently attached to his body and controls his brilliant mind, turning him into a criminal.

items.title: Iron Man (classic)
items.description: Tony Stark, a genius, philanthropist, and billionaire who seeks to atone for the damage he caused by manufacturing weapons and puts his talents to better use by protecting the innocent.

items.title: Judge Dredd
items.description: Dredd, a police officer, judge, and executioner in a dystopian future devastated by radiation.

items.title: Darkseid (color)
items.description: Darkseid, an ancient being who seeks to rule the cosmos using his army and Omega powers.

items.title: Ocean Master
items.description: Orm, prince of Atlantis and enemy of Aquaman. He seeks to seize the throne by any means and establish his tyrannical rule.

items.title: Superman
items.description: Clark Kent (or Kal-El), the last son of the planet Krypton. Adopted by Martha and Jonathan Kent, he grows up to become Superman, the hero and defender of the weak.

items.title: Supergirl
items.description: Kara Zor-El, survivor of the city of Argo (Krypton). After witnessing the destruction of her home city, she is sent to Earth to look after her cousin Kal-El. A detour causes her to arrive later, finding him already become Superman.

items.title: Wonder Woman
items.description: Diana Prince, princess of the Amazons. On the hidden island of Themyscira, home of the Amazons, she grows up training to become the defender of her people's ideals and bring peace to the world of men.

items.title: Batman
items.description: Bruce Wayne decides to turn the death of his parents at the hands of a thief into the driving force of his fight against crime and corruption in Gotham City.

items.title: Wolverine
items.description: James Howlett (Logan), a mutant with regeneration and an adamantium skeleton. A natural hunter with a bad attitude and a good heart.

items.title: Christmas Batman
items.description: Even the Dark Knight can enjoy a celebration of peace and good deeds.

items.title: Retrospective
items.description: When everything has passed, what do we have left?

items.title: An open mind
items.description: A universe of possibilities within every person. What is inside yours?

items.title: Skeletor and He-Man
items.description: Skeletor finally manages to get rid of He-Man, though not in the best way. The cure was worse than the disease.

items.title: Medieval princess
items.description: A glimpse into what the past and history could have been.

items.title: Motorcyclist
items.description: A girl, a motorcycle, and a road.
